reviews.review: Sehr geil!

oke game the end was trying to hard to be phylisophycal and in my opnion was a bit of a let down( not everyone agrees with me) gameplay wasnt really an improvement over the last one even though it had the whole grabling hook. Boss fights were frustrating and the big daddy replacers were infincible. Oke game but by far not as good as the previous 2. But still better then CoD or any FPS's like that.

Bioshock has one of the most intense campaigns I have ever played. 
PROS:
-Spinny melee weapon.
-Great graphics.
-Bloody.
-Hot companion.
CONS:
-End is confusing.
Buy it.

BioShock: After playing the whole series of the game, I can defenitly say its a great game. Everything you know or, at least think you knew about the world we're living at, is all lies. In each of the games you start as a "normal" character, with a casual personality, that during the game change and become a new character with a different personality. The game is about mental games with your brain. You gain new  powers and new abilities the more you're progressing in the game. In each game, the story change alot on each move you make. The whole idea of BioShock game series is really cool in my opinon and so are the action scenes in it and the story of each game. I highly recommend on playing the game, but from the first to the last, one at a time to understand better the story of the games. Great game.
An amazing game that will give you a mind blow.

Oh, Bioshock. Where do I even begin with you? The game is honestly amazing. There's not much more to say; there's really not much more to it.

The scenery is beautiful. The characters are interesting. Elizabeth is the best ally in video game history. The vigor powers are fun as ever.

The story is quite good, but it broke my brain as I tried to fully understand it. I actually had to check on the wiki after I beat the game just so that I could understand it a bit better, and even now I'm not so sure. Not going to spoil anything, but let's just say it's pretty mind blowing.

The amount of action is also really good. It's realistic for the setting and not too over the top, but there are some pretty intense moments. But the game isn't scary like the first two, so the few times that they did try to make you jump out of your seat just felt like they were trying too hard.

So to summarize, just buy it and go kick Comstock's anus. 8.5/10
J'ai bien aimé et je ne suis pas un fan de [i]shooter[/i]. Ça hurle un peu trop à mon goût... :P
Aboslutely loved the game. There is nothing negative I can really say about this dramatic, humorous and full of action piece of art.

Para mi, después de haber completado el juego, me parece infinitamente mejor el primer bioshock. Me explico:

-Creo que tiene mejor jugabilidad, en el primer bioshoc utilicé bastante mas los plasmidos (vigorizantes en bioshock infinite). La accion era más rápida y los controles más acertados que en esta última versión.
-La historia me pareció mucho mejor, en este no he acabado de entender exactamente el final y me ha costado bastante más seguir el hilo. Hay algunas cosas que se me escapan, cosa que con el primero no me ocurrió.
-Los "jefes finales" me parecen bastante mejores en el primer bioshock también, sobre todo el último.
-En cuanto a la estética, sigue más o menos la del primer bioshock pero también hay cosas que me parecieron mas curradas como los mecanismos que salian cuando mejorabas el arma, por ejemplo.

En definitiva, no es que me haya parecido un mal juego, pero no lo recomiendo porque me parece que respecto al primer bioshock es un paso atrás

La déception 2014 pour moi.
Le jeu est magnifique aux niveaux visuel et sonore. Oui le scénario, bien que très tiré par les cheveux est potable.
Mais alors quid du gameplay? Un vrai bordel mêlant toniques pas toujours très utiles et guns surpuissants aux munitions faméliques, avec en dernier des coups de mêlée d'une nullité sans nom. Alors oui il y a les aérotrams qui sont sensés apporter dynamisme, mais le nombre d'ennemis par scène et leur habilité à vous sniper de très loin vont vite vous décourager de faire mumuse pendu aux rails.
Le jeu finit de se ridiculiser dans un combat final d'une difficulté totalement débile, sauf si par chance vous avez upgradé les bons flingues au max (fusil snipe et lance roquette).
Je l'ai desinstallé sans réussir la scène finale, je regarderai la cinématique de fin sur Youtube. Première fois de ma vie que cela m'arrive, mais le gameplay est juste trop désagréable pour avoir envie de percévérer.

Wow, einfach nur wow! Dieses Spiel ist unfassbar Klasse. Die Story ist echt sehr interessant, aber auch meiner Meinung nach, ein wenig verwirrend. xD Das heißt aber nicht, dass ich sie schlecht fande, im Gegenteil, die Story war echt fantastisch und fesselnd. Die Waffen haben mir auch gut gefallen, aber von den Effekten (Plasmiden?) her, nur wenige. Es waren dafür aber auch viele neue dabei. Aber das ist ja Geschmackssache. Die Grafik ist super schön. Einfach atemberaubend. Große Klasse! Man hat beim Spielen dann auch so die Momente, ich jedenfalls, wo man es einfach nur genießen möchte. Das man fast die ganze Zeit eine Person bei sich dabei hat, finde ich ultra cool. Vom Shooter her hats mir auch sehr gut gefallen. Einfach ein mega hammer Spiel und meiner Meinung nach, der beste Bioshock-Teil. Es war auch nicht direkt wie Bioshock 1&2. Man konnte manchmal garnicht mehr aufhören zu spielen, weil es ein so mitgezogen hat. Mir hat es wirklich sehr gefallen, aber ich fande die automatischen Speicherpunkte nicht so toll. Ich hätte lieber nach meiner Entscheidung speichern wollen, aber gut, ist auch kein wirklicher Kritikpunkt. Man gewöhnt sich daran. Ich kann es Leuten empfehlen, die einen Erkundungsdrang haben und auf der Suche nach einer aufregenden Story sind. Natürlich die auch die Shooter Games mögen. Einfach nur TOP! ^-^
Epic but still not as good as the first
MASTER PICE. Faltan palabras para describirlo.

Great game, holy moly.

Pros; Great graphics. Simply amazing story in this game. Very well crafted characters that at least I got very emotionally invested in.

Cons; Combat is a little dull. There isn't much to explore, a few hidden rooms from time to time. You can only carry 2 weapons at once, which also ruined it a little for me.

All in all, I'd recommend this game to everyone. 9/10 from me. Left me all giddy and excited at the end, like a kid who just saw an amazing movie.
this game is a masterpiece

Это абсолютный, беспрекословный, категорический, безупречный, чистокровный, безукоризненный, неоспоримый, безусловный, априорный, безупречный, полный, безапелляционный, неопровержимий, совершенный, безоговорочный, улетный шедевр.
Плюсы:1.Изящно, индивидуально, стильно и со вкусом.2.Исследование сюжета приносит немало удовольствия.3.Зашкаливащая расчлененка и кровавость.4.Атмосфера и ощущение присуствия.5.Можно с удовольствием пройти несколько раз.6.Игровой процес затягивает не на шутку.
Минусы:Не обнаружено. 12/12

I really recommend getting this game. Its very awesome with the models, graphics & overall gameplay. The story is great and very well made.
Loved this game has a strange but amazing ending 10/10

[h1]The bad:[/h1]
- Combat is over-complicated; for the length of the game, the number of weapons, vigors, and tears makes it difficult to master
- Gratuitous ultraviolence; you really don't have much time to enjoy the scenery because you're always dodging bullets and blowing up people's heads

[h1]The good:[/h1]
- Beautiful setting with gorgeous details; visuals and audio alike are both innovative and memorable
- Mind-blowing sci fi; a very well-delivered turn of events that I wasn't expecting going into it
- Strong character-focused story; Elizabeth is especially awesome

[h1]Final verdict:[/h1]
An oppressively dark shooter that is worth it for the technical acheivements and storytelling
[b]9/10[/b]
Increadible game, great story, great gameplay. I would recommend this to everyone
очень крутая игра все на высшем уровне советую скачать не пожелеете
A great game that you can play for hours and still not find all the secrets of the game

I was going into this expecting a semi-weak sequel like BioShock 2.  However, I was pleasantly surprised.  Without overexaggerating, I would have to say this is the best campaign I have played from any game.  It's a linear story but makes you feel like you have choices along the way (so they definitely solved that drawback from linear gameplay.)  The mechanics have been improved from the previous two games, while maintaining the aesthetic.  Basically, the game retains all the best aspects of the previous two and improves upon those aspects that were lacking.  There's almost nothing negative I can say, so if you don't already own this game it is a must buy.
Not much can be said about this game that has not been said already. I love this game. I don't see why you shouldn't buy it.
Words cant even describe how good this game is
The story of this game is exceptional. Paired along with the unusual scene the game provides, different from other games, I would easily recommend this game...

Very good game, but it suffers from a bad ending, which is sad given that this series was known for the best endings ever written.  It's not that the ending is dissapointing, it just makes the rest of the game very confusing and convoluted, also takes away from a lot of the character development taking place through the story.  Get this game, but IMO, I enjoyed Bioshock 1 and 2 better in hindsight (ya bioshock 2 got repetitve, but the last 1/4 of the game was even better than the first, and made up for everything else)
10/10. Не думал, что у меня вызовит такое сильное впеатление.. Особенно конец.. Просто слов нету, хочется плакать и всё :с

Not quite done yet, but I've got to say, nearing the end of the game I suspect and it has been a thrill ride all the way. I never thought I'd play a game where zooming around actually DID feel like I was on a rollercoaster (minus thumping my head on the seat or having an annoying guardrail thing hurting my chest mind you), but the skyrails are fantastic. This whole game is just a delight through and through, with silly twists and turns but a compelling story that just keep you playing and playing. ...My 12 hours on record so far are a straight playthrough that has only been halted by the rare crash which I suspect is some conflict between DX11 and steam, but honestly, the little breaks I've had to take probably are necessary since I otherwise wouldn't stop playing to get any sleep like I'm about to. <3

Good music, good story, good characters (yes, I love Elizabeth to death), surprisingly slightly creepy atmosphere when necessary... I didn't mind the racism, for anyone pointing it out. If you are not a fan of racism, this game will be fantastic for you. ..Why? Because you basically wind up on a mission to burn and destroy the very city and utopia those racists have set up in the sky. Petty, maybe, but undeniably satisfying as hell.

One of the most fantastic games ever made. A must have.

10/10
Es una simplementa una obra maestra, lo recomiendo a cualquiera que pueda jugarlo.
Very well prepared environment. While playing any errors. Personally for me a short story with an interesting late that I did not like but it's just my opinion so someone certainly interesting story.

Такая долгая.. болезненная.. концовка.. сшибает с ног. И совершенно не вяжется с ярким и радостным началом. Чем больше вы узнаете о себе и мире, тем мрачнее и неприятнее он для вас. В конце чувствуешь себя просто душевнобольным, хочется очнуться от всего, что на тебя выливают. 

Вещи в этом мире кажутся настолько сложными, запутанными, непонятными, что мозг отказывается в них верить, судорожно пытаясь найти более простую и понятную замену, но найти такую не может. 

В конце приключения по привычке ожидаешь чего-нибудь хорошего, расслабляющего, в стиле "и жили они долго и счастливо". Но вместо этого еще больше запутываешься и в итоге вообще ничего не понимаешь и напрягаешься еще больше.

Даже не знаю, приятные впечатления или плохие оказала на меня концовка, но одно могу сказать точно - я этого еще долго не забуду, настолько она была эмоциональная. Сравнимо с чтением безумно интересной книги, ну, или, может даже с тяжелыми наркотиками.
Play this game and if you tell me it's bad I'll neck you
Awesome game!!!! Buy it now! :D

Amazing story, great graphics and Elizabeth make this game extraordinarily good.
The story even could have been twice that long and I would have loved to play it. 
Actually, I'm sad that it's already over.

The weapons and shooting engine are ok, but as story/graphics are on such a high level, they seem a bit too weak compared to those. 

Still a 9.5/10.
Great story with lots of mindf*ck, constant action, you can't stop until you finish it, keeps you thinking about what's going on. Beatiful environment. Defo a must play.

Тема множества измерений, сдобренная проблемой премственности, смешана в шейкере ярких событий и захватывающего сюжета. Разраюотчики постарались на славу и игра стоит каждой минуты реального времени.
Рекомендую поклониикам серии, а так же всем, кто только делает первые шаги в мире игр.
P.S. Признаюсь, я боялся, что перенос игры в "небо" погубит всю атмосферу оригиналной версии. Как оказолось, перемены лишь внесли новых красок в игровой процесс, во всем остальном это тот же старый и любимый BioShosk юности.
super!

[h1] This game is awesome [/h1]

As a long time fan of the bioshock series this game does the others justice, not only further explaining the story of the previous two but also creating a wonderful standalone experience for newcomers.

While i do miss the addition of a weapon weel in the main story forcing you to only carry two weapons at a time and the rather lacking number of vigors(being only eight in the main game), these problems are easily overlooked.

I found myself amazed at the sheer number of "wow" and "omg" moments that made the experience even more enjoyable. The graphics were excellent, the plot even more so, and it does this while leaving you with a desire for more. While the controlls took a little remapping to make it feel more "fps" like(changing ads to right mouse click and vigors to Q) the aiming was fluid.

[b] Long story short play this game and i guarantee you'll enjoy it [/b]
Also if you havent i recommend playing the previous two games, whilst they may not be the most "1080p60fps" games out there the story experience will blow you away.

Beautiful game art, intriguing storyline, overall brilliant
Really, REALLY great!

I highly recommend this game as well as the previous BioShock's and even the System Shock titles if you are new to the series. It is very sad the game recieved such low reviews and complaints when it was released, none of them are worth the time reading because Infinite is a great alternative to under the sea adventures, Rapture was a great location and Columbia makes a great opposite environment yet the feel of the previous games is still there.

My only complaint: 

Elizebeth is a darling of a lady and you may start disagreeing with Booker such as when he set the airship to New York instead of Paris as well as other things he does or says. You will probably want to ignore the debt and rescue her way before the airship making many of his statements and actions after not feel right until after Songbird and her sacrifice for you. Booker should have began wanting to help and protect her and by the time they captured the airship It should have came to a choice of dialogue when finaly catching up to her to explain that booker didnt know the coordinates to Paris but he did New York and would get her passage to France once they landed or the original beg for forgiveness scene.

Don't miss a chance to play one of the sickest games i've played in recent memory. From start to finish you will be enthralled and it doesn't hurt that you have one of the most badass companions in gaming history (Elizabeth) at your side to dish out the pain!
bellissimo

I left my wife for Elizabeth

- Tenho de confessar, o jogo é bonito como o cara***, uso os gráficos em ultra e são incríveis. 

- Muita muita muita fantasia, efeitos espetaculares. Tem uma historia engraçada e ao mesmo tempo um bocado confusa, mas acredito que seja por eu ter começado logo a jogar o infinite e nunca ter jogado o BioShock 1 e BioShock 2, acabando por não perceber bem a lógica e sequencia da historia. 

- Comprem o jogo antes que a promoção se acabe e garanto vos que não se arrependem. 

- Foram os melhores 14,99€ (Bioshock Infinite + Season Pass Bundle, promoção final de ano 2014) que já gastei até hoje na steam, só estou arrependido de não ter comprado mais cedo. 

- Estou apaixonado pela Elizabeth, personagem muito bem criada para o jogo apesar de te só auxiliar a abrir portas, dar-te munições e a garrafa dos poderes. Andar no meio de uma cidade flutuante foi o que eu sempre sonhei, ouvindo musica calma e antiga e ao mesmo tempo futurista. Só espero que os programadores não se estraguem e continuem a lançar este belo jogo cada vez melhor.

- Não acreditem nos comentários negativos acerca do jogo, não são totalmente verdade.
10/10 would play again

Okay I am currenty playing the 2nd bioshock, but have (obviously) played Infinite and the 1st. I have to say, for me personally, this game tops the other two quite easily, along with a lot of games. Everything about it is amazing. Stop reading this and buy it!! :D

The story is confusing.. the ending is just horrible,

I hear that the only saving grace is the DLC... that's pretty sad.
I have yet to buy any DLC..
I hope the next Bioshock is better... if there even IS a new Bioshock after this one.

Without having played the first two games, this one has surely peaked my interest in the complete series. With it's interactive world and entising gameplay, i found it a very satisfying gameplay experience.
Bestial. 10/10.

I thought it was a very good FPS though it doesn't really feel like a "shock" game. Doesn't really have the sense of isolation you have in system shock and bioshock. But it is a must own game. On a semi related note, SPOILERS I loved it when Booker and Elizabeth head to rapture. Thought  it was the best thing ever, lol.

If you like story-driven games, then thi is a great choice. While the gameplay can get a bit repetitive, the story is incredibly immersive, and the higher difficulties are fun after you beat the game for the first time.

What can i say about the one of the most anticipated games of 2013 apart from........it delivered. The story in engrossing and truly lets you sink your teeth into the life of booker dewitt and WHY he has gone to columbia to rescue this mysterious girl from the clutches of comstock.
Graphics are beautiful and can run on ultra using a Nvidia GTX 750 ti strom x and fov is recommended for the best experience (which is ready in the options menu already)
heavily recommended to buy right now whilst on sale as i have bought all 3 for £6.50 something get it now.

Game is all about Elizabeth <3
10/10 would Elizabeth again.

Edit (2nd play through): Booker is so consumed with guilt that he developed a condition called Buttonphobia. This is clearly demonstrated in the game as he has the uncontrollable urge to slam his fist into every elevator button, in an attempt to smash it out of its metallic existence. I decided to replay the main game after getting the Season Pass on a sale, and also to complete some easy steam achievements that I've missed.

Edit (Completed DLCs): The 2 Burial at Sea episodes really brings the story together. The plot is well written and matches seamlessly to BS1. I would say the combat in BAS episodes shies away from that of Infinite, especially the stealth approach in BAS2, and was really enjoyable for me.

However, I am really disappointed in the lack of slamming of elevator buttons. Elizabeth did not honor her only friend (in her own words) by mimicking Booker's Buttonphobia. Kappa

After playing the entire Bioshock series, I can safely say these will remain my favourite games for a long while.
Obra maestra de los videojuegos. Fundamental jugarlo. Imprescindible.

Picked this up in a sale amongst a few other games and this was definitley a steal!! The game's storyline is probably the most interesting of the series and all the characters are superb. Considering the majority of the game is escorting a hostage (in a really simplified way of looking at it) its nice that the character your escorting doesn't get in the way and actually proves to be really useful.

Overall I'd give this game 4.5/5. It's hard to pick negatives about this game but i wish it was longer, purely because i enjoyed it so much!

Não bastasse o enredo muito legal, Bioshock Infinite é um shooter divertido e empolgante. As várias armas, somadas aos poderes que o protagonista adquire ao longo do game, tornam a experiência de derrotar inimigos muito mais alucinante se comparado aos outros dois títulos da franquia. Mesmo apresentando cenários mais coloridos que os da antiga Rapture, a 2K e o Sr. Levine acertaram em cheio ao construírem a Columbia de Infinite, trazendo toda aquela carga "weird" de Bioshock do fundo do oceano para os ares!

Avaliação:
Jogabilidade   4/5
Gráfico           4/5
Enredo           4/5

Nota final       4,0

PRÓS: O enredo, ótima história!
CONTRAS: Como já é tradição na franquia, os NPCs são mais interessantes que o protagonista.
You fight the KKK in the sky. Damn KKK are everywhere.

Realmente não tem o que dizer desse jogo, e da Série BIOSHOCK em geral, simplesmente fora do comum em questão de qualidade de tão bom que é a Série BIOSHOCK. Porém como estou analisando o jogo BIOSHOCK INFINITE (terceiro e provavelmente último da série com a DLC Bureal at Sea) vou focar apenas ele.

Ele é o terceiro jogo da saga BIOSHOCK, que por mim, são os melhores jogos existentes, e quando digo isso falo a pura verdade do meu coração, eu amo essa saga infinitamente. O Infinite como os outros 2 jogos, deixa marcado a vida de qualquer gamer ou jogador casual, ele consegue deixar um pedaço dele na sua mente/coração de um modo que você começa a gostar desse game de uma forma fora do comum. A história dele é incrivel, o gráfico é incrivel, ELE É INCRIVEL. Vejo muitos fãs da saga que jogaram o Bioshock 1 e o Bioshock 2, porém não jogaram o 3 por ser meio que diferente dos outros 2, para mim, eu adorei esse como adorei os outros 2,  mas mesmo que ele não agrade alguns, acho que vale a pena de mais ser comprado só pela historia dele, e no final do game quando já tiver zerado ele comprar a DLC Bureal At Sea, que é essencial para fechar a saga e ligar o Bioshock Infinite ao Bioshock 1 e 2.


Prós: -Realmente TUDO no jogo, tudo que foi colocado e feito ficou perfeito, não só nesse, como no 1 e no 2.
         -Ele realmente marca a vida de quem o jogou, parece muito para um jogo, porém esse é fora do comum como eu já disse, uma verdadeira obra de arte.



Contras: -NADA, porém para alguns, o fato do jogo ser apenas legendado em português e não dublado, podem falar que isso é algo ruim, porém para quem já jogou sabe, as vozes da Elizabeth, do Booker e de todos os personagens são tão marcantes e perfeitas que se dublassem, não ia ser tão perfeito.

A triologia Bioshock não pode faltar na coleção de games de NINGUÉM, e quem comprar o infinite, comprem também a DLC Bureal At Sea, que é o desfecho da triologia Bioshock e é o que encaixa o Bioshock Infinite ao Bioshock 1 e ao Bioshock 2

so far this game has been spectacular! the graphics,in my opinion, are beautiful  and the gameplay is excellent. i have seen no real bugs in the game  except for the one time it crashed. that being said there are some things i dont really like about the game but ive chosen to look over them because they are either easily fixed or they are out weighed by other aspects the first of these things is the original key bindings now this problem is extremly minimum and can easily be changed with a quick visit to the settings i dont like that the "Z" key is used to aim down the sights on the gun i feel its best placed on the "r" key thats the one i had the most problems with plus a few others another thing is the use of lock picking on doors that are needed to progress in the story considering that elizabeth is the one to pick the locks and it takes her less than a second and thats more irratating than a bad aspect of the game  all in all i have enjoyed this game so very much and i hope my review helped anyone reading thank you and have a good day (also elizabeth is gorgeous for a video game charactar)

When they made this game I died because Elizabeth and I are twins. 
Down to the same name.
I participated in picking the companion as well, who wouldn't want themselves as a companion c:<
10/10 
This game is executed really well, the characters, sounds, visuals. 
I would recommend this to people with an appreciation for the strange and with a heart for adventure.

Infinite - Vibrant, colorful, rich storytelling wrapped in exciting and constantly evolving gameplay. A true masterpiece of a game. 

Burial at Sea - The greatest value in a DLC I've seen, with a complete storyline that enriches the world of Bioshock and tugs at the nostalgic's heartstrings by returning to Rapture. Gameplay elements stay true to Bioshock in part one, and part two branches off into a stealth style that breathes even more fresh air into game.

good game well played

Bioshock Infinite, ou le jeu connu pour son "mind f***" complet, aussi bien pour le jeu original que pour les DLC (attention, il faut connaitre Bioshock premier du nom). Par où commencer:


- le scénario: c'est LA raison pour laquelle j'ai pris le jeu. Et pourtant, j'en ai vu du gameplay dessus, mais franchement entre y jouer et le voir, y a une sacrée différence. Si certains préférent les Bioshock précédents, Infinite demeure un très très bon cru, avec certes des détails qui peuvent nous faire chipotter pour tel ou tel truc, mais franchement le jeu à quand même l'ambition de nous sortir une histoire complexe et poussée. De plus, les DLC sont excellents eux aussi.

- les graphismes sont très bons, et on peut facilement les monter sans avoir besoin d'une machine de compétition. Sur ce point, rien à dire, c'est bon.

- la bande son est excellente et nous immerge dans un univers à l'ambiance US des années 1900 et des brouettes.

- le gameplay: alors bon, comme dans tout jeu, il y a forcement un élément qui fait office de vilain petit canard... eeeeet en effet, si le scénario est excellent, le gameplay ne va pas plus loin que devant le pas de la porte des FPS. Pourtant, on se retrouve dès le début confronté à une "énigme" (oui, entre guillemets). Et ensuite, bah... FPS FPS FPS FPS. Les pouvoirs semblent se répétés (stun, contrôle, stun, attaque, stun...). Une fois que l'on a compris plus ou moins les mécaniques de jeu, on avance facilement: suffit de maxer une arme (voir 2) et idem pour les pouvoirs (ou je n'ai jouer qu'avec un contrôle et un stun, pour dire).


Alors, que dire de Bioshock Infinite? C'est très simple: si le gameplay n'est pas passionnant, l'ambiance et le scénario font bien plus que de rattraper ce manque, ça l'explose! J'ai adoré l'histoire (fin du jeu+ personnages principaux+DLC qui fout des claques). Mon seul et unique regret est un gameplay trop poussé sur le côté FPS, un côté énigme/réfléxion aurait été le bienvenu. Enfin, je vous le conseille vivement.



                                                                                                                                 ... quoi, comment ça, je suis trop subjectif?

Esta bueno el juego

I loved this game. Mainly because of its rich story where it makes you feel like, you are the person you play as and that you have to protect this girl. Although I must say I really only played this game for the story because after a while the combat started getting repetitive and became annyoying but the story kept me going.

Overview:
Bioshock Infinite is a beautiful game that looks great, has an interesting story and runs very well, unlike the other Bioshock games that usually crash alot. But it is a very mediocre game gameplay wise and also as a sequel. It is VERY simplified. It is just a linear passage with a few rooms branching off that always leads to a dead end just so you can get another piece of gear that you will never use or some money. In the other Bioshock games there were so many branching paths, all connected to each others and rarely had something to stop you (for example, needing Incenerate! to melt some ice) so you could go anywhere you wanted to go. But in Bioshock Infinite its just arena after arena with hit scan bullet sponges with almost no variety. Just tear open Medkits, hide behind them and spam Devil's Kiss and Hand cannon till all enemies are dead.

The Enemies:
There is almost no variety in the game. Vox and Comstock troops are barely different, just the clothing. Their AI is: go out, spam shots, hide in cover again while still shooting. Only 2 enemies use Vigors, the crow people and the firemen and unlike the other enemies  they have good AI but inside they are just bigger bullet sponges. The Handymen? The so called replacements for Big Daddy? Get ready for him because you will see them like 3 times in the whole game and all they do is spam attacks on top of you until they die. Boys of Silence appear 4 times in ONE section of the game, while also being able to avoid them.  Motorized Patriots have a good design and are a bit fun to battle. The other machines are just turrets and a nice helicopter styled machine called Mosquito, and saddly you can't hack any of them. Songbird, the epic giant enemy that pressures you through the whole game? *SPOILERS* You don't fight him.

Mechanics:
Let's start by the obvious. The guns haven't improved and are now even worse. You can only hold up to 2 guns and there is now way to upgrade that. You have to switch your current weapons with others on the ground and maybe you wont even see your old weapon again in 3 areas. It's a horrible idea. Just find 2 guns that you have upgraded and that you "enjoy" using and only use them for the rest of the game. The upgrades to the weapons are even worse. Bland and boring "+25% damage" "-30% recoil" "+20% spread", at least in the other Bioshock games there was always one unique upgrade for a weapon, like the Tesla upgrade for the shotgun.The melee weapon however is pretty awesome since it allows you to execute low healthed enemies and lets you ride skyrails.

Gear. Worse version than tonics because of 2 main reasons: Only a maximum of 4 gear pieces at a time and 2 gear pieces you want to use might want to use can be on the same category, so you can only use 1. In the other Bioshocks you could have more than 15 tonics at the same time and it could even be of the same type! aka you could have Hacker's Delight and Hacker's Delight+ for a stacking bonus.
Talking about hacking it's gone. Replaced by Possession Vigor that uses all your Salt in seconds and it's only temporary. Great idea.

Elizabeth can sometimes throw you money, health, ammo or salts but it's usually in the middle of battle so enemies can just get up and shoot at you right after you grab the item. It's a nice feature but not great. She also seems to make this stuff out of thin air. She also allows you to open tears.
Tears. They could have done so much with them, but instead it's just "Hold F to summon ______!". No clever traps or making cool stuff like a giant hole in the ground so enemies fall in it. It's just either cover, a turret for you or some items.

The removal of Medkits and EVE Hypos (in this game it would probably be called Salt Drinks or something like that) changes the game drastically. You now always have to be behind cover and you rely on finding food and health kits. It is good and bad because it now is not very unique and it also makes you have to always go wandering around for containers in the middle of battle, however food is actually useful now and it isn't cheap beating bosses by simply buying 5 medkits and going 1v1 on him. Still in Infinite you can just get revived and all you lose is some money, so you can cheese bosses that way if you want. This also brings another point, the shield system is just overused and unoriginal since it doesn't do anything special than protecting your precious health.

Skyrails are really fun, especially striking down on your enemies from the skies but all they are used for is to circle around a big arena. They are also quite rare, usually used for moving on from an area to another place.

Last mechanic that im going to talk about is the removal of Adam and Power to the people. Adam, if you didn't know, was a way to upgrade yourself and get new Plasmids in a vending machine. It was hard to get since you had to Rescue/Harvest Little Sisters aka kill Big Daddies. Now since we are in Columbia we don't have Adam so to upgrade and buy some vigors we have to buy them with our money. Boring. And the worse is that it costs so much damn money you can't even get the half of those upgrades in a playthrough. To upgrade yourself (more health, salt or shield capacity) you need to find these weird potion things that slightly upgrade one of those at your choosing. Most of them are in those little rooms in branching paths so you better explore.
Now, the removal of Power to the People makes a new vending machine appear. It SELLS the upgrades, making money even a bigger problem and even more impossible of getting all the vigor upgrades and most of the weapon upgrades. But hey if you spend 3 hours farming Return to Hall of Heroes you might be able to get them all.

Plasmids I mean Vigors:
Not much to talk about. Most of them are from the older games with the addition of putting traps on the ground with also slight changes (Devil's Kiss is Incenerate! but with the option to put a trap on the ground and now you have to throw the bomb instead of it being an instant fire-y explosion on the area you want). Others are a mix of old ones with new things (Undertow is similiar to Telekinesis with alot of changes and the option to throw enemies that are alive and to stun them) and others are original. You also can switch them anytime you want by holding Q, which is quite nice but you can only hold up to 2 at a time. Why change the name even though Rapture and Columbia are just a submarine ride and a magic jet elevator ride away? Who knows.

Last one, the Story:(If you didn't guess, spoilers)
It can go from explaining the city flies with Quantum Physics  (proven to actually be possible) to shooting a GHOST with BULLETS. But now seriously the overall story is great but the ending is just really bad, trying to fuse the whole story together with the magic tearing and a million universes and ends up with Elizabeth drowning you because in another universe you are Comstock. Well there are so many multiple universes that anything can happen, for example Elizabeth being female Hitler or Booker being a god, but Elizabeth still decides to drown you for some reason. It's like fixing a great book that is cut in the middle with a bunch of duct tape. The loss of multiple endings also annoys me. You can do anything you want and you still get a normal ending. For example, in Shantytown there were a bunch of poor people beating a vending machine for money so they could buy food and I could tear open a giant crate filled with bags of food a few meters away from there. I instead exploded those 6 poor guys with my RPG. Elizabeth didn't even say anything.

tl;dr: Behind Bioshock Infinite's beautiful graphics its just a mediocre shooter with the name Bioshock on it's title. Simplified to the max with everything downgraded, it's just not worth 30 euros. Thank god that i got it on a sale.
5/10

Bioshock: QM Works, basically. The game has its flaws, but it's stunningly good at storytelling, game design and overall feel for the characters. 'Quantum stuff' that is incorporated in the game - though pretty simple - fits in really well.
10/10 would re-read all my Egan books again.
Eating Simulator 2014.

BioShock Infinite ist ein würdiger Dritter Teil. Man muss die ersten beiden Teile nicht unbedingt vorher gespielt haben, es ist jedoch empfehlenswert, da sonst ein paar Aha-Effekte ausbleiben. BioShock Infinite überzeugt nicht nur mit einer einfachen, spaßfördernden Bedienung (vor allem für Shooter-Noobs wie mich :-P), sondern bietet auch eine mitreißende, spannende Story! Fazit: Leider geil! :-D
The storyline is perfect, this is highly recommended for people who seeks story of the game.
SOOO atmospheric and immersive. Combat's not bad, story's not bad, but if you want to believe in a steampunk flying city, buy this game :)
